name: Greater Reveal
pages: Though my _Hexes can use $(l:hexcasting:patterns/basics#hexcasting:print)$(action)Reveal/$ to transmit information to my mind, the resulting message is ephemeral â€” unless I stand still and reflect on what I've heard recently, it will slip away like anything else someone says. Additionally, constantly hammering my mind with iotas distracts me from more important things.

Thus, I've devised a new pattern of my own. It's similar to $(l:hexcasting:patterns/basics#hexcasting:print)$(action)Reveal/$, but the message is lodged well within my mind, and I forget it instantly if I replace it with something else. It can also take a list of messages, for convenience.

pages.text: Takes a list of iotas (or a single non-iota, which is treated as a list with one element) and displays them permanently to the caster. Displayed iotas survive all methods that would clear a normal Reveal, and can only be cleared by another casting of Greater Reveal.

pages: $(o)To be a Hexcaster is to glimpse a truth that might best be hidden./$
